profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities include helping multinational organizations to secure effective international recruitment, embark on effective compensation, and strategic means to succeed in
learning and development. I assist in effective staff development issues, identifying
performance and other related administrative problems, proposing effective measures/solutions, and evaluating and monitoring results. I also assist supervisors to define international recruitment and retention needs, develop strategies to encourage broad and diverse pool of international applicants, counseling employees on career paths while assisting international managers to implement strategic HR policies based on the diversity issues of their organizations.
 
On diversity issues, some of my duties include helping IHRM to identify cultural differences among their multinational
workers, knowing their impact and how to manage them for an effective organizational growth. I also give extensive lectures on diversity issues in conferences.

2006-2009: Guest Lecturer. Courses taught included the following:
1. HRM
2. International Marketing
3. Economics.

It should be also noted here that I have taught high school students from 1993-1995.
